title: PSA: Malphite is not OP. AD meta is OP. Malphite is a Dark Knight.
body:
Stop hating the Shard of the Monolith because he's a free win against your multiple ADC cancer. He was only S-tier when Marksmen and AD assassins became S-tier and AP mages became garbage tier. Cause and effect.

For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.

If he was removed from the game, who would we be complaining about then? I'm curious.

Everyone wasn't complaining before pre-season. Because it was before all the AD buffs and Mage item nerfs across the board. There have been minimal changes to him in the past years.
To be fair, Malphite is going to be strong across all metas because he's so simple and his ultimate is game changing.

Not really.   He is really really bad when AP tops are strong and popular, because they completely stomp him unless he builds to counter them, at which point everyone else on the team stomps on him.

Malphite abuses times where AD stack metas are strong, just like Rammus does.  This is because in such metas, their niche value skyrockets to be a big 24/7 100% uptime powerspike.   Same with Taric.



There is a reason all of these champions went from average win rates to top tier win rates within a single patch.  It has little to do with them, and everything to do with how they sit in the meta as one of it's few natural counters right now due to how weak all the competing metas are.

That's the reason for his current strength. Gaining an extra 100 armor at all times is insane.

Malph only gains 100 armor from his passive if you build armor items only.  You'd have to build {{item:3742}}, {{item:3068}}, {{item:3025}}, {{item:3047}}, {{{item:3143}}, and either {{item:3075}} or {{item:3512}} to breach 300 armor (of which 30% is stacked on top of it.). You're getting an extra 300 health from Strength of Ages, plus 400 + 15% from Cinderhulk. 

The build you listed above is totally normal for a Malphite. With all the health he gets, plus his passive giving him 10% more, plus his ultimate basically being all he needs, a bit of magic damage isn't going to bring him down fast enough for him to not make an impact.

Fact is, you can pick Malphite into any team comp and just do fine.

Most Malphites do not jungle. Most Malphites go top, which necessitates Grasp of the Undying.

That alone pretty much makes everything you just said bullshit.

Not really, Malphite is actually a counter to Fiora. His passive shield absorbs all of her true damage, his attack speed slow drastically reduces her ability to do damage, his Q keeps her from disengaging effectively, Thornmail syngergizes extremely well with his kit, and if all else fails he has Ult. I've honestly never lost against a Fiora when I play Malphite.

Malphite has been sitting at a high win rate for quite awhile, even before the marksmen update. I believe he had a 52% win rate across all skill levels before the marksmen update, which was then raised by 2% with AD becoming more prevalent. I would definitely say that for such a simple, niche champ he's pretty healthy and his current rise in win rate and popularity is due to meta shifting in his favor, as OP stated.

I'm not even mad to be honest. A champion meant to thrive in this meta is thriving in this meta? Sounds good to me. It would be a good deal more alarming if he wasn't. We all know the Boards sound the alarm bells if he wasn't, and for good reason in this case.
